channel.title: Client/source working with mac?
channel.description:
Really want to get a client or source that works for macs, my friend will be hosting who has a pc all we really need is a source/client that a mac can use...
Help is really needed!
Thanks

item.title: Client/source working with mac?
item.dc:creator: @LatestLeech LatestLeech
item.description:
@LatestLeech wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:394332”][quote author=LatestLeech link=topic=491518.msg3594401#msg3594401 date=1304928325]

well no since most servers use a .bat to run…and i tried on my pc when i try to compile it i get “The system cannot find the path specified”…ffs im using godsrampage 562 loading 602 compiler…

Most servers don’t use “.bat” to run. They ALL use Java to run. A .bat, or batch file, is basically a script for windows, so people don’t have to type out
[font=Courier]
java -cp lib/a.jar:lib/b.jar:lib/c.jar path/to/main
[/courier]

Every time.

The error you are getting is caused be an invalid path to the Java binary files on your system.

Since all Macs ship with Java, all you have to do is open Terminal, cd to where you have the server files, then java path/to/main

i stoped trying to use my mac since i cant get it to work (me and my friend just want a small server to pk eachother on >.>) im on my pc, could you help me figure out the correct path to run the client?
[/quote]

look exacly for what, im getting confused now haha

Look in the Tutorials Section. It’s stickied.[/quote]

Read full topic
